title: Identify "Pirate" font with right side swash on A
content:
Hello all,

I need to know the font that is on the cover of this book - it is almost reminds me of a Pirate font, but it has a right side swash on the letter A and the serifs are different from most Pirate fonts - so I am not really sure if it’s one or not.

Any guesses?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090731144245im_/http:/typophile.com/files/grace_5103.jpg)

Thanks in advance!

karen

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [grace.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20090731144245/http:/typophile.com/files/grace.jpg) | 39.99 KB |
author: tallgirltexas

comments.content: Oops, I thought this was a proposal for identifying pirated fonts. (No idea on the i.d. Sorry.)

Hmm. I don’t see the swash on the letter A in the character map [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/dstype/kartago/kartago/characters.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20090731144245/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/dstype/kartago/kartago/characters.html "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/dstype/kartago/kartago/characters.html") but it is the same there is on the R and the K.

Michel, Thanks so much - I don’t know how the “A” got the side swash...but you’re right - everything else looks the same!

K

<cite>I don’t know how the “A” got the side swash...</cite>

The font EULA allows you to do that in Illustrator. With “Type \> Create Outlines” you can get the splines of both an A and a K or an R and then take the swash you want from the K or the R and put it on the A.
